text.div:
Narrativa gerada: StructureDefinition identifier-lifecycle-rules

NomeBandeirasCard.TipoDescrição e condicionalismos
Extension Extension
extension 2..*ExtensionExtension
Fatias para extension Conteúdo/regras para todas as fatias
extension:previousMPID S0..1ExtensionMPID anterior
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"previousMPID"
value[x] 0..1stringValue of extension
Exemplo Exemplo: BR-ANVISA-001234
extension:previousPCID S0..1ExtensionPCID anterior
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"previousPCID"
value[x] 0..1stringValue of extension
Exemplo Exemplo: BR-ANVISA-001234-P001
extension:changeReason S1..1ExtensionMotivo da mudança
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"changeReason"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptValue of extension
Vínculo: Motivos de Mudança de Identificador (required)
extension:changeDate S1..1ExtensionData da mudança
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"changeDate"
value[x] 0..1dateValue of extension
extension:changeSeverity S0..1ExtensionSeveridade da mudança
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"changeSeverity"
value[x] 0..1codeValue of extension
Vínculo: Níveis de Severidade de Mudança (required)
extension:impactedProducts S0..*ExtensionProdutos impactados
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"impactedProducts"
value[x] 0..1Reference(MedicinalProductDefinition | PackagedProductDefinition)Value of extension
url 1..1uri"http://farmaco.maxapex.net/brig/fhir/StructureDefinition/identifier-lifecycle-rules"
value[x] 0..0

Documentação para este formato

name: IdentifierLifecycleRules
title: Regras de Lifecycle de Identificadores
description: Regras e tracking para lifecycle de identificadores MPID/PCID - define quando manter vs criar novos identificadores
purpose: Rastrear mudanças em identificadores MPID/PCID e aplicar regras de lifecycle conforme padrões internacionais ISO 11615
copyright: Copyright © 2025 Farmaco.io. Este trabalho está licenciado sob a MIT License. FHIR® é marca registrada da HL7 International, usada com permissão.

element.definition: Optional Extension Element - found in all resources.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](http://hl7.org/fhir/R5/extensibility.html) for a list).
